newsitem.title: FRANCE: Union Miniere France raises zinc price.
newsitem.headline: Union Miniere France raises zinc price.

text.p: Union Miniere SA subsidiary Union Miniere France said on Monday it was raising its indicative zinc price to 11,980 francs per tonne -- its third price increase in less than a week.
The company had last raised its price, to 11,270 francs, on Friday.

Shares in the Belgian non-ferrous metals group firmed in Brussels as zinc prices rose to a seven year-peak on the London Metal Exchange following news that Chinese zinc smelters were holding large short positions in the metal.
Union Miniere was up 35 francs at 3,505 at 1246 GMT.
